text: For reference: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/sample-projects#managing-layouts-flex-and-box|Here> is the sample project for Flex and Box :slightly_smiling_face: The Flex playground card will help you experiment with the properties of Flex to see which works for you.

Hey all,

We have just tried deploying a UI component card in production using the HubSpot CLI - the card doesn't show in the record tab customization even though it works fine in a staging environment. Anyone has any idea why the card doesn't show in the records tab customization ?

• The project is deployed
• The beta is opted in 
• The scopes are fine 
Cheers !
Did you add your card in the record page customizer?
It doesn't show in the record page customizer which is precisely the problem :^) if you have ideas why i'd be happy to hear them!
oh sorry completely spaced on that part of the sentence haha, does you project show up in the CRM customization tab?
is it possible that your card is named the same as a default card?
The actual name is bespoke but the uid isn't, do you think this could be it?
It's possible that might be the issue if you already have a card that's named the same

We don't; no cards were deployed in production except this one just now, everything was done on a sandbox prior to this
What's weird is that the project and private app definitely show up in the HubSpot UI, we're only missing the actual possibility to display the card on a record
(note: the title and uid are the same on staging and do show in the record tab customization)
yeah that's very strange
and you see the project and app in the crm customization page?
:wave: hi — I’ve got the same error/warning that I’d like to clean up — it works at runtime. Was there a solution that worked, <@U02DYFPJH4J>?
yep
Make sure to use the latest version of the HubSpot package
@latest tag
<@U04EJHVD8FM> raising this to your level
<@U068QRCQ3U2> Seth is a Level 10
Thanks a lot man - high enough of a level to start raiding then :grimacing:
Have you tried going here and adding it to a view?
sorry to ask what’s probably an obvious question… but I inherited this project… is that specified as `"platformVersion"` in hsproject.json?
Yep, that's my point - it doesn't show up as a card that can be added to a view <@U04EJHVD8FM>
interesting.
whats your portalId?

For the record, the card is setup to show on company records, so we're using
<https://app.HubSpot.com/record-settings/THECUSTOMERSID/0-2/middle-column/manage?eschref=%2Fcontacts%2F43790555%2Frecord%2F0-2%2F18169161502>
and I'm assuming no build errors/etc.
I can check the build logs on our end/etc with the portalId
No build errors indeed, I'll get back to you asap with the production portal ID as i have no access to it
you're connected to the prod portal via CLI though right?
Yep, we were doing it through the customer via video chat and screenshare, guiding them along

To clarify - I have access to the sandbox where we've done all development and testing. Then we cloned the repo and had the customer deploy it with HubSpot cli, getting the PAT through their production environment.
we then validated via screenshare that the build was successful, the project and private app created.
The only problem is that the customer cannot select the actual card in the record tab customization panel
Ah ok. So its the exact same project you were working on
Yep, only HubSpot.config.yaml should be different
this is the public npm package. `npm i @HubSpot/ui-extensions@latest`
are you using `platformVersion` ?
Not to the best of my knowledge
oh good question
in your hsproject.json
I meant it is there but i'm not explicitly using it anywhere
Let me bring this to the projects team. I think I've hit my limit on how much I can help.
Thanks a lot anyway :^) hope you guys can figure out a fix as this is preventing our customer for using what we've done for them :catcoder:
I'd love an update if and when you have one, I'm happy to jump on a call as well if needed. Again, I don't have access to prod so i might need to then guide the customer along
Hi <@U068QRCQ3U2>, we discovered that the build was kicked off before the production account had opted into the beta, and that's why the card ~was~ wasn't available. Could you try uploading again?
is it a typescript error?

I think so:
```TS2339: Property fetchCrmObjectProperties does not exist on type```
though I can see that property _does exits_ in `types.d.ts` so I’m guessing it’s related to the IDE/project configs.
I’ve found another project here that isn’t having this same error.

do you have this in your HubSpot.extend
```HubSpot.extend<'extension-point-location'>((props) => <MyApp/>)```
you need to type the function like I put above
is this the documentation: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components>? I’m looking for what  `'extension-point-location'` and `<MyApp>` should be in my context.
I need help please on CRM development displaying of iframe modal. I pass a different url but it still shows on my iframe the HubSpot's website
it corresponds to `'crm.record.tab' | 'crm.record.sidebar'`
`MyApp` is whatever your function is called. (In your case it looks like its `Extension`

Make sure you're using an absolute url like `<https://www.example.com>` not `<http://www.example.com|www.example.com>`

Otherwise what's likely happening is that it's trying to load `<https://app.HubSpot.com/www.example.com>` and showing an error screen.

You should be able to confirm this by going into your network tab and looking for a weird URL like the one above.

Hello.  First post.  Forgive if this has been addressed before.   I am building an `ui-extension` for a tab on the deals screen.  I really dont want to use `number` input fields.  I’d very much prefer a `slider` component.  Is there any possible way to leverage custom components? or submit a component for approval?  or something similar?
Ah, got it. Thanks:+1:
Not currently at this time
You could you an iframe and build out a webpage to do this but that kinda defeats the point
Yes, it was an absolute url. No error shown. I passed  the openIframeModal function on my child component, does it matter?
Hi <@U06E57ANWV9> :wave:, could you share your extension code to help with debugging?
ok, thats what I thought.  that's unfortunate.
thank you
I'm not entirely opposed to an iframe option, but can you pass parameters to the iframe (ie userid, deal/record id)?
of course
